intro: Solanum micrantherum, commonly known as the small-flowered nightshade, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves and small, white or purple flowers. Its fruits are berries that mature to a yellow or orange color, containing several seeds. Solanum micrantherum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
